data.scheme_name: Biotechnology  Industry Partnership Programme (BIPP)-Shared major facilities around technology platform-Existing
data.benefits: Under this scheme, Financial support for advanced technology is provided on cost sharing basis. This scheme provides BIRAC contribution up to 50% of project cost as Grant-in-Aid and remaining cost is to be met through the company/LLPâ€™s.
data.eligibility:
The proposals can be submitted by following :
 a. Single or consortia of Company (ies)*incorporated under the Companies Act, 2013 or 
b. Limited Liability Partnership (LLP)** incorporated under the Limited Liability Partnership Act, 2008 jointly with or without the following:
                 - Public/private university/colleges in India 
                  - National research laboratories 
                -  Not-for-profit private research labs/societies/foundation/NGO
data.conditions: All concerned applicants need to sign the Grant-in-aid Letter Agreement (GLA) with BIRAC
data.beneficiaries:
a. For Company/LLP:- Minimum 51% of the shares of the Company should be held by Indian Citizens holding Indian passport [Indian Citizens do not include Person of Indian Origin (PIO) and Overseas Citizenship of India (OCI) holders] ** Minimum half of the persons who subscribed their names to the LLP document as its Partners should be Indian citizens. The Applicant Company/ LLP should:

 i. Have adequate in-house facility to address the project implementation(which shall be evaluated during the site visit) or

 ii. Incubated at any of the recognized Incubation Facility 

b. For Academic collaborator: Eligible Academia shall mean an entity which is having proper establishment documents For Public or Private Institute, University, NGO, or Research Foundation, proper registration/accreditation from a government body is mandatory like UGC affiliation certification, AICTE, CSIR /DSIR/SIRO certificate
data.context: This scheme is introduced for development of appropriate technologies in the area of agriculture, health, bioenergy, green manufacturing.
data.objective: The main objective of this scheme is for promoting innovation research in the Biotech sector.
data.description: The financial support by BIRAC would be 50 % of the approved Project cost to the Company/LLP fund recipient and rest 50% would be borne by the Applicant company/LLP
data.how_to_apply: Proposals are required to be submitted online only. Online proposal submission can be done by registered users during an active call only. Candidates can apply through https://birac.nic.in/cfp.php
data.funding_mechanism:
The fund disbursement is milestone based and is released in 5 instalments: 

1st instalment on signing of GLA 30% 

2nd instalment on completion of 1st technical 20% milestone 

3rd instalment on completion of 2nd technical milestone 20% 

4th instalment on completion of 3rd technical milestone 20% 

5th instalment on Submission of Project Completion Report 10%
data.highlights:
Impact of Biotechnology Industry Partnership Programme (BIPP) : 
Total number of projects supported: 214
Total fund disbursed: Rs. 523.79 Crore
Total products/technologies developed: 52
Facilities developed through BIPP support: 9
Total IPs generated: 31
data.faq:
Q.) What is BIPP?
Ans.  The Biotechnology Industry Partnership Programme (BIPP) was launched on December 5, 2008. It is a government initiative that partners with industries to support path-breaking research in frontier futuristic technology areas within biotechnology. The goal is to promote innovation, enhance economic potential, and make the Indian industry globally competitive
Q.) What does BIPP aim to achieve?
Ans. BIPP aims to extend support to high-risk research projects within the industry. It operates on a cost-sharing basis, with the government bearing 50% of the approved project cost. By fostering collaboration between industry and research, BIPP contributes to the development of transformational technologies and processes in the biotech sector.
Q.) What types of projects are supported by BIPP?
Ans. BIPP supports projects that focus on IP creation, with ownership retained by Indian industry and collaborating scientists where relevant. These projects align with recognized national priorities and contribute to the growth of the biotechnology sector.
Q.) How can Industrial benefit from BIPP ?
Ans. Industries can leverage BIPP to undertake cutting-edge research in areas with significant economic potential. By participating in BIPP supported projects, industries gain access to government funding and collaborate with experts to drive innovations and competitiveness.
data.additional_info: Proposals submitted by companies defaulting on repayment of loan or are irregular with regard to repayment of instalments to BIRAC would be considered ineligible.
data.checklist_info_a:
1.) Udyam Registration Certificate
2.) Utilization Certificate
3.) Statement of expenditure
4.) Grant-in-aid letter agreement
5.) Project submission documents
6.) No Lien account
7.) Letter of agreement
